page.title: 05HOUSING
page.content:
{ HOUSING IN LEIGH AND BRANSFORD (1)
A small development of chalet bungalows is currently being built on the site of the old Rectory on the south side of the Alfrick Road at Bransford. The Rectory, a large 17th century listed timber frame building, was demolished some twenty years ago and the new Rectory was sited on the Suckley Road. At about the same time a number of detached bungalows and houses were built in its environs, as well as sheltered accomodation for pensioners.
About fifty years ago a small council housing development was built on the Suckley Road, whereas most of the other housing is privately owned.
